http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/sdc/StructureDefinition/sdc-questionnaire-observationLinkPeriod says "Indicates the time-period (from 'now') to search for observations that match the Questionnaire.item.code and Questionnaire.subject when pre-populating the QuestionnaireResponse"

What's the relationship between Questionnaire.item.code, Questionnaire.item.definition, and ObservationDefinition? I think it makes sense for Questionnaire.item.definition to also be able to reference an ObservationDefinition...

What is the motivation for doing that?

Questionnaire.item.definition currently provides a number of fields for the item (required, repeats, maxLength) which an ObservationDefinition does not have. (I am also not sure the type fields align, though I think there is a pending GForge item to adjust the item.type for R5).
no they would be inferred with a little more challenge from ObservationDefinition. OTOH, using an ObservationDefinition would be more helpful if you 're using observation-link-period
How would ObservationDefinition be more helpful to observationLinkPeriod than item.code?
